In a lush, green forest, a vibrant bluebird named Lira once soared through the skies with grace. One fateful day, she was so entranced by the beauty of a flower that she forgot to flap her wings. Days turned into weeks, and Lira lost her confidence, believing she had forgotten how to fly. One evening, a wise old owl perched nearby encouraged her to remember the joy of the wind beneath her wings. With a deep breath, Lira took a leap from her branch. To her surprise, the familiar rush of air returned, and she soared higher than ever, rediscovering her freedom.
